webFeature.description_html: The WebSocket API opens a two-way communication channel between the user's browser and a server.
webFeature.name: WebSockets

webFeature.description_html: The navigator.gelocation API requests the user's latitude, longitude, heading, and speed.
webFeature.name: Geolocation

webFeature.description_html: The web animation API programmatically creates, inspects, and controls element animations, to change and synchronize appearance over time.
webFeature.name: Web animations

entity.name: WebGL
entity.description: A low-level API for rendering 2D and 3D graphics with the GPU on `<canvas>` , based on OpenGL.
entity.descriptionHtml: A low-level API for rendering 2D and 3D graphics with the GPU on <canvas> , based on OpenGL.
entity.descriptionClean: A low-level API for rendering 2D and 3D graphics with the GPU on <canvas> , based on OpenGL.

webFeature.description_html: The WebGLRenderingContext API is the "webgl" rendering context for the <canvas> element. It represents a space for drawing two- and three-dimensional graphics and animations.
webFeature.name: WebGL

webFeature.description_html: The document.visibilityState and document.hidden properties tell you whether the page is visible to the user (for example, it's not minimized or in a background tab).
webFeature.name: Page visibility

webFeature.description_html: The WebAssembly.instantiate() and WebAssembly.instantiateStreaming() global static methods load WebAssembly code (also known as Wasm), a portable binary instruction format.
webFeature.name: WebAssembly

webFeature.description_html: The WebRTC API establishes real-time communication channels directly between browsers. It is commonly used in video conferencing applications.
webFeature.name: WebRTC

webFeature.description_html: The web authentication API allows you to create public key-based credentials and use them for authentication, such as when signing in. Also known as WebAuthn.
webFeature.name: Web authentication

entity.name: Temporal
entity.description: Provides standard objects and functions for working with dates and times.
entity.descriptionHtml: Provides standard objects and functions for working with dates and times.
entity.descriptionClean: Provides standard objects and functions for working with dates and times.

webFeature.description_html: The Temporal API allows you to work with dates, times, time zones, and durations. It is more powerful than the Date API.
webFeature.name: Temporal

webFeature.description_html: The BroadcastChannel API allows you to send messages between same-origin browsing contexts, such as between the same page loaded in multiple tabs.
webFeature.name: BroadcastChannel

webFeature.description_html: The navigator.getGamepads() API accesses and responds to signals from game controllers.
webFeature.name: Gamepad

entity.name: `navigator.xr` (WebXR Device API)
entity.description: Create AR/VR sessions with compatible output devices.
entity.descriptionHtml: Create AR/VR sessions with compatible output devices.
entity.descriptionClean: Create AR/VR sessions with compatible output devices.

example.code:
const xr = navigator.xr;
const session = await xr?.requestSession("immersive-vr");
example.codeHighlighted: const xr = navigator.xr; const session = await xr?.requestSession("immersive-vr");

webFeature.description_html: The navigator.xr API represents the browser's virtual reality or augmented reality system. You can use to request a WebXR session.
webFeature.name: WebXR

entity.name: Scheduler API
entity.description: The Scheduler API provides a way to prioritize all tasks belonging to an application.
entity.descriptionHtml: The Scheduler API provides a way to prioritize all tasks belonging to an application.
entity.descriptionClean: The Scheduler API provides a way to prioritize all tasks belonging to an application.

example.code:
scheduler
  .postTask(() => "Task executing")
  .then((taskResult) => console.log(`${taskResult}`)) // Log result
  .catch((error) => console.error(`Error: ${error}`)); // Log errors
example.codeHighlighted: scheduler .postTask(() => "Task executing") .then((taskResult) => console.log(`${taskResult}`)) // Log result .catch((error) => console.error(`Error: ${error}`)); // Log errors

webFeature.description_html: The scheduler API provides a way to prioritize all tasks belonging to an application.
webFeature.name: Scheduler API
